docs.lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors have subpoenaed documents from Oregon's health exchange agency as part of a grand jury investigation into how the state used federal money to set up the now-failed health insurance exchange, state officials said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Federal Prosecutors Subpoena Oregon Health Agency in Grand Jury Probe

docs.snippet: Federal prosecutors have subpoenaed documents from Oregon's health exchange agency as part of a grand jury investigation into how the state used federal money to set up the now-failed health insurance exchange, state officials said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Did the Bank Bailout Do Enough for the Country?

docs.lead_paragraph: Americans for Prosperity, the conservative advocacy group supported by the Koch brothers, has launched an effort to torpedo a proposed settlement in the Detroit bankruptcy case, potentially complicating chances for completing the deal just as its prospects seemed to be improving.

headline.main: Koch Brothers Group Prepares to Fight Detroit Deal

docs.lead_paragraph: In Turkey, where 301 men were killed when a fire tore through a coal mine last week, people are beginning to consider the costs of a new way of life that emerged over the past decade.

headline.main: After Mine Disaster, a Painful Awareness of What Has Been Lost
headline.print_headline: After Mine Disaster, a Painful Awareness of What Has Been Lost

docs.abstract: Koseler Journal; village of Koseler lost 14 men in the coal mining disaster in Soma, Turkey; residents of villages like Koseler, who have been increasingly turning to coal mining for the promise of more money and greater security, have been left to think about mining's costs, such as losses of rural traditions, social cohesion, and now lives.
docs.snippet: In Turkey, where 301 men were killed when a fire tore through a coal mine last week, people are beginning to consider the costs of a new way of life that emerged over the past decade.

docs.lead_paragraph: Between Bill’s soliloquies and Barack’s slump, she’s got problems.
docs.abstract: Frank Bruni Op-Ed column examines obstacles facing Hillary Clinton if she chooses to run for president in 2016; holds her relationships with Bill Clinton and Pres Obama could prove to be liabilities, as could her long political career at a time of deep public pessimism concerning Washington; notes she will also be up against a brutal defamation campaign from Republicans and endless satire in the media.
docs.snippet: Between Bill’s soliloquies and Barack’s slump, she’s got problems.

docs.lead_paragraph: As voters head into primaries on Tuesday in the southern swing state of Arkansas, one of the most fiercely debated issues among Republican candidates is the centerpiece healthcare policy of President Barack Obama, a Democrat.
